article.headline: Furman 63, The Citadel 60
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Moussa Diagne scored 17 points and Tony Carter hit a go-ahead 3-pointer with three minutes left to lift Furman past the Citadel 63-60 on Monday night. The Paladins (13-9, 6-4 Southern Conference) watched their 58-50 lead disappear after Citadel's 10-0 run. When Dante Terry hit a 3-pointer to close the spurt, the Bulldogs (12-9, 4-7) were ahead 60-58 with 3:50 remaining. But Carter hit his three just 38 seconds later to regain the lead for Furman. The Citadel could not recover as it lost its fourth straight game. Kevin Hammack had a lay-up opportunity in traffic that would've put the Bulldogs ahead in the final seconds. But he could not convert and Furman's Eric Webb closed the scoring out with two foul shots. Robby Bostain added 16 points for the Paladins. Carter finished with 6 points and 10 rebounds. Warren McLendon and Matt Davis had 10 points each to lead The Citadel.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
